Job description:
Senior PR Specialist
Full job description
Your main role is to:

Content Creation:
Develop high-quality content for press releases, blogs, social media posts, newsletters, and other communication materials.
Ensure all content aligns with the brand’s voice and messaging strategy.
Media Relations:
Build and maintain strong relationships with media contacts, journalists, and influencers.
Proactively pitch stories to media outlets and respond to media inquiries.
Strategic Planning:
Develop and implement PR strategies to enhance the company's public image and achieve business goals.
Identify opportunities for public relations activities and campaigns that support the brand.
Crisis Management:
Handle crisis communication effectively to protect the company's reputation.
Prepare crisis communication plans and conduct media training for spokespersons.
Social Media Management:
Oversee the company’s social media content creation when tasked.
Monitor social media trends and adjust strategies accordingly.
Media Event Management:
Plan and execute PR events, such as press conferences, product launches, and media tours.
Coordinate logistics and manage event budgets.
Analytics and Reporting:
Track and measure the effectiveness of PR campaigns using analytics tools.
Prepare reports on PR activities and provide insights for continuous improvement.
Collaborative Work:
Work closely with marketing, sales, and other departments to ensure cohesive messaging and integrated marketing efforts.
Collaborate with external agencies and vendors as needed.
Content Review and Editing:
Review and edit content created by junior team members to ensure high quality and consistency.
Provide constructive feedback and mentorship to junior PR staff.

Who are we looking for?

Education: Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Public Relations, Communications, Journalism, Marketing, or a related field.
Experience:Minimum of 5 years of experience in public relations, communications, or a related role.
Proven track record of successful PR campaigns and media relations.
Skills: Excellent English Language Skills: Superior written and verbal communication skills in English.
Second Language Competency: Proficiency in a second language is highly desirable.
Content Creation: Strong ability to create engaging and impactful content for various platforms.
Media Relations: Proven ability to build and maintain media relationships.
Social Media Expertise: Good knowledge of social media platforms and best practices.
Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze PR campaign performance and derive actionable insights.
Crisis Management: Experience in managing crisis communication effectively.
Project Management: Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Team Collaboration: Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.

Intern, PR & Communications
Job Description
A brand has its own identity, attitude, beliefs, story and character – and just like many successful startups, AirAsia MOVE is our new identity and our story to tell. We are in the midst of formulating a brand identity that has relevant content with an emotional promise and has an appealing personality. This brand of ours coupled with our current fast-paced on-goings (new deals, new brand image, new hires) should be effectively communicated both internally amongst our AirAsia MOVE family and externally with our stakeholders and the public.

As an Intern PR & Communications, you will be working with a mix of Thailand PR and Regional PR team. This role will be based out of our office in Bangkok, Thailand.
On a daily basis, you will work across internal teams including the Marketing, Merchant, Merchandising, Partnership and Product team, as well as other Lines of Businesses in AirAsia MOVE.
You will fit perfectly if you enjoy a fast-paced working environment with passionate colleagues. Having a knack for capturing the spirit of a concept with still and moving images, and a willingness to experiment with fun-spirited visual communications will make you stand out in this application!

A DAY IN A LIFE
As a start-up, you can expect your days to be pretty varied. Multitasking is normal, and sometimes, your skills or natural talents will be leveraged to support other business priorities. That said, the bulk of your working hours should involve you having to:
Contribute to creative ideation and execution of all communications activities, including for internal communications, external marketing campaigns, and for visual and merchandising problems that may arise.
Coordinate and execute design and visual solutions for corporate and marketing campaigns, in still or moving images.
Collaborate with creative, marketing, branding, product and other teams.
In the loop of industry-wide trends to create engaging and culturally relevant visual communications that inspires, engages and sells.

At the onset, you may be culture-shocked working in AirAsia. To help you adapt better, we would like to share our beliefs on leadership. Put simply, you are a leader, we all are leaders and good leaders:
Roll up their sleeves as needed, and never delegate work that one would not be willing to do themselves.
Do what is needed to get things done, as they believe speed is more important than anything else to effect change.
Over-communicate, particularly as they are all quite autonomous.
Take care of our staff, and treat them as they would want to be treated.
Are rigid on goals, but flexible on the details.
 SKILLS
These are minimum-requirement skills and a ‘must-have’ for the role:
Proficient in a variety of methods to convey ideas and concepts (e.g. storytelling, storyboards, mood boards, concept treatments, etc.).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to meet deadlines and adapt quickly to changes.
Independent and requires minimal supervision.
Meticulous and self-driven.
Fun with a positive nature.
 These are skills that are ‘nice-to-have’ and will make you stand-out in the job application:
Detailed oriented and thoughtfulness that are translated in the deliveries of your work.
Must be able to multitask and work well under pressure.
People person and team player.
Resourcefulness in finding solutions.
Strong design background; understanding of typography, layout, form, color and spatialization; well versed in design process and production methods.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Degree or Studying in Mass Communications, Advertising, Media, Journalism or English Language.
Can commit with at least 3 months internship and above.

PR Manager
Full job description
Apple's communications team shapes and shares with the world the stories about our innovative products and services, and the values that drive everything we do. We’re looking for trailblazing, collaborative professionals from a variety of creative fields. Inclusion is a shared responsibility, and we work together to foster a culture where everyone belongs and is inspired to do their best work. Come and do the best and most exciting work of your career at Apple! The PR & Corporate Communications Manager in Thailand will report into the Head of Corporate Communications & PR, Southeast Asia. This role will drive planning and execution of our corporate communications programs and consumer PR initiatives across the Thai market, proactively communicating Apple messages to targeted media, content creators and influencers. This role supports across all of Apple's products with an emphasis on social-first campaigns. We are looking for candidates that possess strong PR and communications skills, along with a consistent track record driving PR results across consumer technology, consumer lifestyle and business and news media. Ideal profiles are passionate about cultivating new relationships with media and creators, and skilled at developing unique narratives and storylines that resonate with Thai online audiences. 

Description

- The successful candidate will bring energy, ideas and an appetite to drive fresh and relevant storytelling. - This role will work in partnership with the hub team, supported by a local, cross functional marketing team to create strategies and deliver campaigns that increase awareness and understanding of products and software. - The successful candidate will work cross-functionally to create and deliver the activity that increases awareness and understanding. This may include other product PR managers from the hub, including Apple Intelligence and operating systems, SEA product PR Managers across iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, education and health. - This role will help devise and implement global communications initiatives that resonate with the local audience. Responsibilities will include strategic planning and execution, identifying and managing issues in a fast-paced environment and continuous news cycle. It will work collaboratively with the wider management team in the region and also be tightly coordinating with the SEA PR team to support and drive the understanding of Apple’s products and values. - This hands on, media relations and leadership role will work with our agency team to help find new relationships amongst the talent and communities that use our products to deliver the world’s most exciting work, and will be tasked with leading our efforts in finding new media and social platforms through which we can tell those stories. - Travel across the region is required. 

Minimum Qualifications
BS/BA or equivalent experience preferred
10+ years experience in public relations, influencer relations or PR agency in Southeast Asia.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills in Thai and English.

Preferred Qualifications
Effectively builds formal and informal relationship networks inside and outside the organisation.
Develops and delivers effective communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
Analyses complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.
Understands internal and external stakeholder requirements, expectations, and needs.
Understanding of Smartphone or PC market an advantage.
Experience in media relations and developing a network of media contacts in creative, tech, design and cultural platforms
Successfully delivered creative PR campaigns that have created meaningful impact
Self-motivated, possess a positive team-player attitude and passionate about consumer technology. Self-starter who is dedicated and demonstrates creative and critical thinking abilities
Able to work with ambiguity and on complex topics across multiple jurisdictions
Able to influence and gain alignment from others in sensitive situations-without damage to the relationship.
